intro: Tephrosia sabulosa, commonly known as sand tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or coastal soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its leaves are pinnate, with several pairs of leaflets. Tephrosia sabulosa is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments.
